Authors:
adel pordel, Seyed Akbar Khodaparast, Eric H.C. McKenzie,
Mohammad Javan-Nikkhah
Title: Two new species of Pseudopyricularia from Iran
Abstract:
Two new species, Pseudopyricularia hyrcaniana and P.
javanii are described, illustrated and discussed. Sequencing and
analyses of the large subunit (LSU) of ribosomal RNA genes, the internal
transcribed spacer (ITS), largest subunit of RNA polymerase II (RPB1)
and Calmodulin (CAL) genes confirmed their placement in
Pseudopyricularia. Pseudopyricularia hyrcaniana was isolated as a
pathogen from infected leaves of Cyperus alternifolius, while P. javanii
was from Juncus effusus. Conidia of P. hyrcaniana are obpyriform or
obclavate and 1-septate; those of P. javanii are fusiform or
cylindrical, and 2-septates, that distinguish two species from each
other and species. Analysis of multigene sequences confirm the
distinction between P. hyrcaniana and P. javanii and reveal their
relationship with the allies in Pyriculariaceae.
